meanings.definition: A short musical composition for a solo instrument, often used for practice or study.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her piano etudes diligently every day.
meanings.sent2: The violinist performed a beautiful etude at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The etude was so catchy that it got stuck in her head all day.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced on the piano keys, turning the etude into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the etude lingered in the air long after the performance ended.

meanings.definition: A piece of music designed to improve a particular aspect of a musician's technique.
meanings.sent1: The music teacher assigned a challenging etude to help her student improve.
meanings.sent2: Practicing etudes can help musicians master difficult techniques.
meanings.sent3: The etude was like a musical puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent4: She tackled the etude with determination, aiming to perfect her skills.
meanings.sent5: The etude pushed her to new heights of musical proficiency.

meanings.definition: A study or exercise designed to improve a specific skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: He completed a series of math etudes to enhance his problem-solving skills.
meanings.sent2: The language etude helped her become fluent in French.
meanings.sent3: The etude on time management made him realize the value of planning.
meanings.sent4: She approached the etude on public speaking with enthusiasm and determination.
meanings.sent5: The etude on leadership taught him valuable lessons about teamwork.
